title.native: 長門有希ちゃんの消失

description:
This spin-off of the Haruhi Suzumiya series takes place in the world of the "Disappearance" arc of the original novels, focusing on the high school life (and romance!) of a tentative and bashful Yuki Nagato quite unlike the one you've come to know and love through the usual exploits of the SOS Brigade... but no less charming!

As the shy head of the Literature Club, Nagato has had a hard time recruiting members. Her close friend Ryoko Asakura supports her in this. Drafting Kyon, she eventually meets up with Haruhi Suzumiya, Tsuruya, Mikuru Asahina and Itsuki Koizumi, and has to put up with their hijinks while trying to romance Kyon. Asakura seems ambivalent about the latter prospect.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

node.description:
__Machida Touko__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakuribo)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/伊藤郁子)

Known for her work as a character designer on [Sailor Moon](https://anilist.co/anime/530/) and [Princess Tutu](https://anilist.co/anime/721/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mariko_itoh222) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/okome2014/)

In 2008, she married fellow animator [Tatsufumi Tamakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/109607/Tatsufumi-Itou), who changed his name to Tatsufumi Itou after marrying her. 

Her husband passed away from a brain hemorrhage on May 23, 2020.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mariko_itoh222) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/okome2014/)

In 2008, she married fellow animator [Tatsufumi Tamakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/109607/Tatsufumi-Itou), who changed his name to Tatsufumi Itou after marrying her. 

Her husband passed away from a brain hemorrhage on May 23, 2020.

__Machida Touko__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakuribo)

__Residency:__ Hino City, Tokyo, Japan
__Graduated:__ Berklee College of Music (Department of Film Scoring)

[Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/evancall) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/evan.call.33) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0nMGbTpPx4b3h5fMG9CpWJ) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/realevancall)

Joseph Maurice Ravel was a French composer, pianist and conductor. He is often associated with impressionism along with his elder contemporary Claude Debussy, although both composers rejected the term. In the 1920s and 1930s Ravel was internationally regarded as France's greatest living composer.

Achille-Claude Debussy was a French composer. He was one of the most prominent figures associated with Impressionist music, though he himself intensely disliked the term when applied to his compositions. A crucial figure in the transition to the modern era in Western music, he remains one of the most famous and influential of all composers.   (Source: Wikipedia)
